title: User Authentication and Security Framework
summary: Implement secure login and multi-factor authentication for customer access.
description: Develop a secure authentication module that allows bank customers to log in using multi-factor authentication (MFA). This component will handle user identity verification, password policies, session management, and secure logout mechanisms. It will integrate with existing identity providers and ensure compliance with banking security standards such as PCI DSS. Security auditing and logging will be enabled for all authentication transactions.

title: Core Portal Setup and Responsive UI Framework
summary: Design and build the foundational self-service portal with responsive design.
description: Create the initial portal infrastructure with a focus on responsive web design, ensuring accessibility and usability across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. Establish a modular front-end architecture that supports dynamic content rendering, fast loading times, and adaptive layouts. Implement a consistent theme, navigation, and user experience aligned with the bank’s branding and usability standards.

title: Integration Layer with Core Banking System
summary: Establish seamless integration between the portal and the core banking system.
description: Develop APIs and services to connect the self-service portal with the bank’s existing core banking systems. The integration will enable real-time retrieval and submission of account and customer data, ensuring high reliability and performance. Implement robust error handling, logging, and monitoring mechanisms to maintain data consistency and operational transparency.

title: Personalized Customer Dashboard
summary: Provide a dynamic dashboard showing personalized banking products and services.
description: Design and implement a customer dashboard that displays personalized information, including accounts, products, and services relevant to the user’s profile and eligibility. The dashboard should support dynamic content delivery, quick navigation to services, and user-friendly data visualization. Personalization will be driven by customer attributes and behavior analytics derived from integrated systems.

title: Account Opening and Service Modification Workflows
summary: Enable customers to submit account opening and service modification requests online.
description: Implement interactive and guided workflows allowing customers to open new accounts or modify existing services through the portal. The process should include data collection forms, document upload capabilities, eligibility checks, and digital signature support. Workflows must be optimized for simplicity and speed, with auto-save functionality to allow customers to resume incomplete applications.

title: Notification and Real-Time Status Updates
summary: Provide real-time request status tracking and automated email notifications.
description: Develop a notification engine that provides real-time updates on the status of customer-submitted requests. Integrate an automated email notification system to inform users of critical updates, approvals, and pending actions. The system should use event-based triggers and ensure reliable delivery of communication while maintaining compliance with data privacy policies.

title: User Activity History and Data Management
summary: Maintain comprehensive logs of all user interactions and transactions.
description: Implement a user activity tracking system that records all interactions within the portal. This system will provide a historical view of applications, modifications, approvals, and communication logs. Data will be securely stored and made accessible via the customer dashboard, ensuring auditability and compliance with data retention requirements. Proper indexing and search capabilities should be included for efficient retrieval.

title: Role-Based Access Control and Authorization Management
summary: Enforce role-based access to ensure appropriate user privileges and security.
description: Develop a centralized role-based access control (RBAC) system to manage permissions across the portal. Users will have access only to features and information permitted by their role and authorization level. Integration with existing identity management will ensure consistent enforcement of security policies and facilitate future scalability for additional roles and groups.

title: Local Database and Performance Optimization
summary: Develop a local data store to enhance performance and ensure reliability.
description: Set up a dedicated portal database optimized for fast read and write operations, caching frequently accessed data, and maintaining operational independence from the core banking system. Implement synchronization mechanisms that update data in real time or near real time while ensuring fault tolerance and data integrity. The database architecture should be scalable and designed for high availability.
